availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Be it Remembered that of this the 10th day of August one thousand Eight hundred and Sixty three personally appeared before the Subscriber a Notary Public in and for the County and State aforesaid Walter Scott and made oath in due form of Law that he would Support the Constitution of the United States and the Sonstitution of the State of Tennessee and that he will without favour or partiallity honestly faithfuly and diligently discharge the duties of Commisioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky Sworn to and Subscribed before me day and date above written in testimony whereof I have hereunto Subscribed My name and affixed My notaryal Seal

figure.ab:
W. D. ROBERTSON
NOTARY
PUBLIC
NASHVILLE, TENN.

body.p:
W D Robertson
Notary public
Walter Scott
